steps.title: This phrase means “goodbye until the next time we see each other.”
steps.content: This phrase means “goodbye until the next time we see each other.” It’s a polite and friendly way to end a conversation, and it also expresses the hope that you’ll see this person again in the future. It can be used in casual settings (like conversations with friends) or formal settings (like meetings at work). Here are some examples of the phrase in conversation: [1] X Research source “Thanks so much for meeting with me. We got a lot of great work done, and I’m looking forward to our next conversation. Until next time!” “I had such a great time catching up with you today. I’m so glad we hung out, and we definitely have to do it again soon. Until next time!” “This has been such a wonderful dinner. I wish we could all see each other more often, but at least we got to have this great reunion tonight. Until next time, everyone!” “It was so great chatting with you, and I can’t wait until our next meeting. Until next time!”

steps.title: “Until next time” can be flirty in certain situations.
steps.content: “Until next time” can be flirty in certain situations. “Until next time” means “goodbye until we talk again,” which essentially means that the other person wants to talk to you again. So, if you’ve been having some flirty conversations with your crush and they say this phrase to you in person or over text, it can definitely be a sign that they’re into you. Here are some examples: [2] X Research source “I had such a great time hanging out tonight, and I can’t wait to see you again. Until next time!” “I’m having so much fun texting with you! But I guess we should both get some sleep since we have to get up early tomorrow. Until next time 🥰” “Just wanted to text to say goodnight, and that it was so great to see you today 😍 Til next time!” Note: Keep in mind that “until next time” isn’t always flirty; it can be purely professional or friendly sometimes. You’ll need to pay attention to the context and look out for other signs of flirting to determine whether or not this person has feelings for you!

steps.title: Respond to “until next time” with any parting phrase you’d like.
steps.content: Respond to “until next time” with any parting phrase you’d like. When someone says “until next time,” they’re basically saying goodbye to you in a friendly way. As a result, it would be appropriate to respond with a phrase that expresses well wishes to the person and a desire to talk to them again in the future. Here are a few examples: Example 1 Person 1: “It was so great catching up with you. Thanks so much for making the time to meet for coffee. Until next time!” Person 2: “Of course! I’m so glad we got to hang out—I had a great time. See you later!” Example 2 Person 1: “Thanks for all your hard work on this project. It’s turning out great, and I’m looking forward to our next meeting. Until next time!” Person 2: “It’s been a pleasure to work on this with you! I’m looking forward to our next meeting as well. Talk to you soon!”

steps.title: Talk to you soon
steps.content: Talk to you soon This parting phrase basically means the same thing as “until next time.” It’s a way to say goodbye while also expressing your hope to talk to the person again in the near future. For example: Person 1: “ Thanks so much for calling me today! I missed you, and it was so great to catch up.” Person 2: “ Of course! I’m so glad we got to chat. Talk to you soon!”

steps.title: See you later
steps.content: See you later Like “until next time,” the phrase “see you later” is a polite and friendly way to say goodbye to someone and acknowledge that you’ll be seeing them again soon. It works in casual and professional settings. Person 1: “I think we got a lot done at this meeting, and I’m feeling good about the presentation. Thanks for the hard work!” Person 2: “I agree! I’ll make those revisions so we’re all set for the presentation on Monday. See you later!”

steps.title: Catch you later
steps.content: Catch you later “Catch you later” has basically the same meaning as “see you later” but it’s more casual and informal. It’s best to use this phrase when saying goodbye to friends, rather than when saying goodbye to professional colleagues. Person 1: “Shoot, I’ve got to head out now to make it home in time for dinner.” Person 2: “No worries! Catch you later.”

steps.title: Bye for now
steps.content: Bye for now The phrase “bye for now” is essentially a synonym for “until next time.” They both mean “goodbye until we see each other again,” and they both suggest that someone is looking forward to the next time you meet. Person 1: “This was such a great lunch. I’m so glad we got to see each other, and I can’t wait until next time!” Person 2: “Same here! Thanks for making the time to meet up. Bye for now!”

steps.title: Don’t be a stranger
steps.content: Don’t be a stranger “Don’t be a stranger” is a common way to say goodbye, and it also expresses a desire that the other person will reach out again soon. It basically means “feel free to reach out any time.” Here are some examples: Person 1: “It was so amazing to see you. Let’s do it again soon!” Person 2: “Absolutely, we’ve gotta hang out more often! Don’t be a stranger.”

steps.title: Take it easy
steps.content: Take it easy This phrase is a casual, low-key way to say goodbye to someone. It works best in informal settings, such as when you’re ending a hangout with friends. For example: Person 1: “I had so much fun today. See you guys later!” Person 2: “Me too! Take it easy, guys.”

steps.title: Take care
steps.content: Take care “Take care” is a friendly, upbeat way to say goodbye at the end of a conversation or meeting. Like “until next time,” it can work in both formal and informal settings. It also expresses a hope that the other person will take care of themselves (i.e., stay healthy and well) until you see them again, which is a nice sentiment. Person 1: “Thanks for a great meeting. I really enjoyed it, and I’m looking forward to next time.” Person 2: “Of course, and thank you too! Take care.”

steps.title: Farewell
steps.content: Farewell “Farewell” is a formal, old-fashioned way to wish someone well when saying goodbye to them. It’s not used super frequently nowadays, but it’s a polite and kind parting phrase, so you may want to try it out! Person 1: “I just wanted to wish you a very fond farewell as you get ready to start your new job. I’ll miss being your coworker.” Person 2: “Thank you so much! I’ll miss working together, too.”
